author: jerenkrantz
msg: ra_serf: Improve pool usage within the update report.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/update.c
(report_dir_t, report_info_t): Add in pool field associated with directory
and file; Store base_rev field with the dir and delta_base URL with file.
(push_state): Create independent pool for root, dirs, and files. (may want
to delay the pool creation even further); split the props to be dir-based
instead of global.
(open_dir): Lazily open dir_batons so we don't exhaust fds.
(close_dir): Move from later in file; ensure our baton was opened; clear
dir's pool when we close it; don't take an explicit pool - we'll use the dir
pool instead.
(handle_fetch): Open dir and file batons when we get our file response;
use appropriate pools.
(delta_file, fetch_file): Init prop_ctx to NULL; delay opening baton; use
appropriate pools.
(start_report): Store our base_rev; don't open batons here; use appropriate
pools.
(finish_report): Don't pass a pool; remove items from the pending_dir_close
list.

author: malcolm
msg: Change the behaviour of 'svn blame' so that the default operative revision
range will be taken from the target's peg revision (if so provided),
for consistency with most of the other 'svn' commands.
This is a minor change to existing behaviour: if a peg revision is
provided without an explicit revision range, we will now display the
file as it was at rPEG, rather than at HEAD/BASE.
Review by: julianfoad
* subversion/svn/blame-cmd.c
(svn_cl__blame): Check for a peg revision before determining the
operative end revision, and use that peg revision as the default
operative end revision (or if no peg revision was specified,
fall back to HEAD or BASE, as before).  Also rename local variable
'is_head_or_base' to 'end_revision_unspecified', to better represent
the condition that's being evaluated.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/blame_tests.py
(blame_peg_rev): New test.
(test_list): Add the test.

author: malcolm
msg: Followup to r18363.  Reinstate checking of the svndiff version number
when reading the svndiff header.  Also remove an assumption (added in
r18363) that the svndiff header will arrive in one piece.
* subversion/libsvn_delta/svndiff.c
(write_handler): Check for the svndiff0 and svndiff1 headers explicitly,
and raise an error if neither was found.  Use the same
incremental-match logic that was used before to make sure that the
version is still set correctly when the header arrives in more than
one piece.

author: malcolm
msg: Followup to r18363.  Revert some unneeded changes made in that revision,
per discussion with dberlin.
* subversion/libsvn_delta/svndiff.c
(read_window_header): Revert the changes made to this function in
r18363, since the additional 'version' argument wasn't used for
anything - and because version-checking is better handled by
a different function anyway.
(svn_txdelta_read_svndiff_window, svn_txdelta_skip_svndiff_window):
Partially revert the changes made to these functions in r18363,
removing the svndiff_version argument from the calls to
read_window_header().

author: dlr
msg: A follow-up to r18382 to improve code cleanliness.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/switch_tests.py
(relocate_beyond_repos_root): Move 'URL: ' portion of the regex used
to verify that the switch worked outside of the call to re.escape()
to improve comprehensibility (and insignificantly, performance).
Suggested by: Peter Samuelson <peter@p12n.org>
Review by: lundblad
